newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybean futures end mixed in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybean futures end mixed in slow trade.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended mixed in slow trade on Monday with most investors remaining on the sidelines, traders said.
The key November 1997 contract ended at 3,280 yuan ($396) per tonne, rising 22 yuan. It opened at 3,290 yuan, hitting an intraday high of 3,291 and a low of 3,220 yuan per tonne.
July rose 41 to 3,345 yuan, September fell two to 3,258, the January 1998 contract fell five to 3,220 and March was down 60 to 3,200. Combined volume fell to 13,700 tonnes from 18,300.
Soybeans opened mixed and moved around opening levels for most of the session, traders said.
"Many investors would rather take be wary because of lack of market-moving news, and that is why today's trade is so slow," one trader said.
"Soybeans are likely to move in a narrow range in the next few days with the market remaining sluggish for a long time," he said.
